intro: Amphineurion acuminatum, commonly known as the sharp-pointed sea anemone, is a marine invertebrate belonging to the order Actinaria. It is characterized by its elongated, slender body and long, delicate tentacles that are used for capturing prey. This species typically inhabits shallow coastal waters and is often found attached to rocky substrates. Its radial symmetry and lack of a true skeleton are typical features of the Anthozoa class. Amphineurion acuminatum plays a role in marine ecosystems by contributing to the food web and providing habitat for smaller organisms.
